name: ttl_multiplier
description: This dial sets the value by which we multiply the max-age part of the cache-control response header

values.description: Use this to simulate a world with fully personalised pages, bypassing the Varnish caching
Use this to pass through the max-age value unchanged
Use this to triple the max-age to alleviate excessive load, such as when recovering from a complete failure
Use this to 10x the max-age in case of extreme instability of the platform

name: logging_level
description: This sets the logging level of the application

values.description: Sets the logging level to debug
Sets the logging level to info
Sets the logging level to warn
Sets the logging level to error (this is the default value)

name: circuit_breaker
description: This enables or disables circuit breaker usage

values.description: Enable circuit breaker usage
Disable circuit breaker usage

name: personalisation
description: This enables or disables personalisation at a global level.

values.description: Enable personalisation
Disable personalisation

name: obit_mode
description: This enables or disables obit mode

values.description: Enable obit mode
Disable obit mode

name: ccp_enabled
description: This enabled the CCP and writing of fallback responses to S3

values.description: CCP is enabled and will write fallback responses to S3
CCP is disabled and fallback responses will not be written to S3

name: monitor_enabled
description: This enables the sending of data to Monitor

values.description: Enables the sending of messages to Monitor
Disables the sending of messsages to Monitor

name: webcore_kill_switch
description: If active this will block requests to the Webcore platform, still allowing other platforms to work as expected

values.description: Disables the sending of requests to Webcore
Enables the sending of requests to Webcore

name: webcore_ttl_multiplier
description: The value selected is used to multiply the max-age value for the cache-control on Webcore requests

values.description: Multiplies the max-age by 0.5 for Webcore requests
Multiplies the max-age by 0.8 for Webcore requests
Multiplies the max-age by 1 for Webcore requests
Multiplies the max-age by 2 for Webcore requests
Multiplies the max-age by 4 for Webcore requests
